Name: RDRTResponses
Title: RDRT: Reviewing Responses
Body:
How Responses to RDRT Alerts are linked to Missions and Members

Incoming responses to RDRT alerts are automatically linked to the respective mission and roster member profile.

For this to work correctly, the member must:

  • reply from an email address registered with his profile in RMS
  • include the mission tag from the alert in the reply

Most email programs would automatically include the mission tag along with the alert message when you just click "Reply". That does not always work, however.

Messages which could not automatically be linked to a mission will appear in the Inbox, where they can be linked manually to a mission.

See at the bottom of this page what to do if the message could not automatically be linked to the correct roster member.

How to see the Responses for a particular Mission

Open the Mission Profile and find the "Responses" section:

Each response card contains:

  • the member name and organization
  • date and time when the response message was received by RMS
  • the response message
  • a list of attachments of the response message
  • information about previous deployments and performance rating

Click "more" to expand the message text on the response card.

Attachments can be opened by clicking the file name(s). Use right-click to download them instead.

How to open the Member Profile

The member name (not the organization name!) in the response card is linked to the member's profile containing all necessary background information.

Click the member name to open the profile in a new browser tab:

If a Response Message could not be linked to a Member Profile

If you see a simple email address in place of the member name, then the response message could not automatically be linked to a member:

You can link the response message to member manually. Click the Edit-icon on the response card to open a window to edit the response data:

Click into the member field and enter a few letters of the name, select the member from the drop-down list and click save to link the response message to this member.

How to add Comments

You can add comments to response cards, e.g. to make notes or capture additional information:

Click the Edit-icon on the response card to open the Edit-window, and then enter your notes into the "Comments" box. Click "Save" to update the card:

If a Response Message was linked to the wrong Mission

It could happen that a response message was linked to the wrong mission. In this case you can manually re-assign it to the correct mission.

Click the edit-icon on the response card to open the edit window, choose the correct mission from the drop-down, then click "Save":
